meanings.definition: Existing in or as part of a tradition; long-established.
meanings.sent1: The family celebrated the holiday in a traditional way, just like they always did.
meanings.sent2: She wore a traditional dress to the cultural festival.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to meow in a traditional manner, but it came out as a squeak instead.
meanings.sent4: His painting style was traditional, yet it conveyed a sense of modernity.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the traditional dish filled the kitchen, bringing back memories of childhood.

meanings.definition: Adhering to tradition; following long-established customs or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The school held a traditional ceremony to honor its founders.
meanings.sent2: He preferred a traditional approach to solving problems.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel had a traditional way of storing nuts, always in the same spot.
meanings.sent4: Her traditional views clashed with the progressive ideas of her classmates.
meanings.sent5: The town's traditional values were evident in its architecture and festivals.
